intro: Taraxacum guanchicum, commonly known as the Canary Islands dandelion, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant features a rosette of basal leaves that are typically hairy and lobed, with a greenish-yellow flower head that develops into a tuft of white pappus. It thrives in rocky and coastal environments, showcasing adaptability to harsh conditions. Its presence in the Canary Islands highlights its ecological significance in local flora.
